newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania trade deficit down to $37.6 mln in August.
newsitem.headline: Romania trade deficit down to $37.6 mln in August.

text.p: Romania's trade deficit narrowed to $37.6 million in August from $131.2 million in July, due to a 33.7 percent rebound in exports, National Statistics Board (CNS) data showed.

NOTES -- All figures in FOB prices. The CNS 1996 import data include oil imports, for which custom documents were delayed in July, but do not include oil imports for which custom papers were not cleared by end-August.
A CNS report said Romanian imports rose by 14.2 percent in August, when they were 6.3 percent up year-on-year.
Between January and August exports dropped by 8.1 percent from the year ago period and imports fell by 12.9 percent.
Common metals and textiles took some 36 percent of eight- month exports, while minerals accounted for 26.8 percent of Romanian imports, CNS data showed.

Some 53 percent of January-August exports went to and more than half of imports came from European Union countries. Germany was Romania's main trading partner. -- Mirela Eremia, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
